Reviews.Title: “Berlin Goodness”
Reviews.Author: shaun g
Reviews.Content: Wow...this is truly a fantastic hotel. All the staff from reception to restaurant were very polite and ultra helpful. They all spoke excellent English and could not do enough for you. the roomsa were very clean,beds very comfortable and spacious.Excellent shower and easy to use TV and safe. Cleaned everyday and stocked up well with toiletries . Breakfast was very very good. A great choice of hot and cold food. The menu in the restaurant was a litttle limited but very good food. Its about 15 minutes walk from Checkpoint Charlie and Frederick Street ( English) and it shoukld cost between 20 and 25 euros from Tegel airport. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good find for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Matt-T78
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a trip for 5 guys visiting Berlin to celebrate a 40th birthday. The hotel is well located on a quiet street in the Mitte district, a 15 minute walk from Alexander Platz. Although bar and restaurant options in the immediate vicinity are not extensive, there are a few possibilities and some excellent coffee shops and bakeries, and it only takes 10 minutes or so to find some really good eating and drinking options. The location is equally good for sightseeing with Checkpoint Charlie, Potsdamer Platz, Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, Tiergarten, Unter den Linden, Babelplatz, Berliner Dom, Museum Island, the river Spree and of course Alexander Platz easily walkable. The hotel is modern and clean with good sized rooms; we ordered two twin rooms and one single and all had double (ish) beds. The rooms also come equipped with tea & coffee facilities and modern bathrooms and offer comfortable and quiet respite from the city. The hotel staff were helpful and polite, even giving us some ideas about where to go in the evenings. Given the price, I think this hotel represents a good option for anyone on a city break in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Free internet? No way!”
Reviews.Author: StarEye2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine and overall a good deal for the price and the location. Nevertheless the hotel advertise free Internet access. In reality you get the first hour of your stay free. For the rest of the time you will be charged 10€/day for an extremely slow connection. Your best bet if you stay in Berlin for more than 2 days and need Internet, is to buy a prepaid SIM card with data access from a local operator. Depending on the operator sim plus traffic will cost you around 25€ for a month and up to 1Gbytes of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, nice people, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sav_c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and paid Euro 129 for B&B, which for a capital city is very good. The hotel is fairly new, very clean with very pleasant and helpful staff. The room I had was large, had 2 Queen sized beds, a desk, sofa, coffee table and LCD TV. There was a good size en-suite. All of it was clean and comfortable. My colleagues and I had a drink in the bar where the lady serving was very nice. The prices were not ridiculous as you would expect in a hotel. Breakfast was functional, on a par with most hotels in the same band as the Courtyard. My only minor gripe is to do with the room TV and Internet. The TV remote in most Marriott hotels for some unknown reason is a nightmare, the buttons don't work properly or they are unresponsive. This is a killer if you're trapped there for business and can't really go out to entertain yourself. Internet access is available through the TV or through BroadBand cable. Don't really understand why they offer a package to have either internet through TV + all movies for Euro 19 or BB line internet Euro 9. Why not BB line internet + TV together in one package? The hotel does not appear to be in a lively area but is only a few minutes walk away from Checkpoint Charlie, the Berlin Wall and a generally more touristy area. It took about 30 minutes to get to the airport from the hotel, in normal traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: chip22
Reviews.Content: We spent close to a week here in early February. The rooms were nice and new and well appointed. The bed (as with all Marriotts I've stayed in) was very comfortable. We had plenty of space for all of our luggage (2 large suitcases, one carryon and a backpack). A good amount of storage. The bathroom was a nice size too. The front desk staff were were nice and quite friendly. They were very helpful with directions and called us cabs and even ordered pizza for us (since we were too sick to go out and dint peak enough German to call ourselves) The only small issue is that it was kind of hard to find from the metro station (which let's you out seemingly in the middle of nowhere). There is a lot of construction right now on Axel-Springer Strasse which confused a lot of our cab drivers (and might make it hard for someone arriving by car). Overall we enjoyed our stay (despite being sick for much of it)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to metro but in dull neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BrianSix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new, the rooms are nice and the lobby nicely decorated. It is a short walk to the Metro and Checkpoint Charlie. Very clean. There isn't much nearby in terms of food nearby. There is a Lidl grocery store nearby, and a bakery. Quiet neighborhood at night, but seemed safe to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on all accounts”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: Got a really good deal on price, definitely 4 star standard- clean, comfortable rooms, extremely helpful staff (actual sent them looking for hypoallergenic pillows for me and they obliged instantly!), lovely overall appearance, great transport links, but also close enough to walk to most of the big sights. I even recommend a couple of the little bars across the street for a night cap- really friendly owners and great fun. I really have nothing bad I could possibly say about this place- couldn't recommend it more. I just signed up to tripadvisor, so my only regret is that I didn't get this review in sooner to share with everyone how much better this hotel made my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Becca_Becs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December for 4 nights with my friend. I last stayed in a Courtyard in Munich and liked it so thought this one would be nice too. It is nice, warm, clean friendly staff. The breakfast is fantastic and loads to choose from, I don't normally eat breakfast but we spent ages on this one. There was all the usual stuff but the fruit was lovely and cold, the pastries very fresh and really nice donuts too. The room was fine although lacking on storage for clothes, I am sure we would have been provided more hangers if we had been that bothered. The blackout curtains worked very well, I hate not knowing if it is light outside when I wake up so I kept them open a bit. Also, the room was very warm, I normally need a second duvet but had the window open one night, it did cool down with the a/c but I don't like the noise when it is on overnight. The location is ok, we took the Metro everywhere but we could have walked, I believed the blurb that Berlin is big and sprawling, actually, I don't really think it is. On the first night we ate tea at the hotel because it was late and we couldn't find any nearby restaurants, the food was ok, but I was very hungry so not sure how nice it would have been otherwide. Would definately stay here again but I would walk rather than get the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, dead location though”
Reviews.Author: kracmunkie
Reviews.Content: Came here for a few nights in September. Hotel was fantastically clean and quiet. Check in was smooth. Housekeeping was prompt and on point. Location isn't ideal, it's in a rather dead part of town. Not that many restaurants or interesting things nearby. There is a grocery store around the corner so that's really convenient for snacks and drinks. It's not too far from the U-bahn stop so at least you can get around fairly easily.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriott Berlin vey convenient for short stay”
Reviews.Author: cevir
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed the comfortable and quiet atmosphere in the middle of bustling Berlin for two nights. I am sure to come back here another time. Extra assets: large clean rooms, quiet situiation but still only a few minutes on foor away from the city centre, a nice morning breakfats from 6:30 till 10 and a superb cuisine in the restaurant "Oleo pozzo".

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: annemieopdorp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a 5 min.walk to the Spittelmarkt U station, about 15 min. to Checkpoint Charlie or 20 min. to the Museuminsel and Unter den Linden. Excellent location, especially when the public transport is striking, what was the case for us. The staff on the reception is very friendly, speaks English fluently. The information about citywalks starting from the hotel showed on a map was not very precise. After 1 day we could do it better. The nice rooms are spacious, comfortable and well maintained with coffee and tea-possibility, flat TV, safe, 1 free bottle of water in the refrigerator. Good beds with excellent lights. The aircon is a little bit noisy. The breakfastbuffet : excellent and fresh, with 4 different kinds of fruitjuice, a great variety of bread, muffins etc..., eggs, cheese, meat, salmon, vegetables, fruits, yoghourts, grains, etc... We got a discount of 25 % : 30 € for two people instead of the first asked 40 €. There is a small fitnessroom and a nice sauna: we visited, but we didn't use it by lack of time. In the surroundings you can find some good restaurants with oriental food.

Reviews.Title: “Good but watch the $$ amenities”
Reviews.Author: GregCnATL
Reviews.Content: Really good location, the rooms are very nice and clean, the staff is very helpful and speak good English. HOWEVER, internet is 10 Euro for 24 hours, breakfast is quite expensive as is their mini mart. There is not much of a choice of coach tours the hotel has to offer, or on the internet that I can find.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: jnaviation
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 1000 meters from all major landmarks such as Alexandersplatz, Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Dom, Potsdamersplatz. Facilities are average, and subway station is about 100 meters form the hotel. Don't expect a superb service, but its still a convenient hotel. Internet surcharges are about 9 euros, and the hotel doesn't have any room service. I think is an average hotel for the money, much better than a hostel or standard 3 stars, but not as good as other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gmcc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year. The location is very good. We were about 2 mins from the UBahn. It is about a 20-25 min stroll to Alexanderplatz; 10 mins to Checkpoint Charlie and 10 mins to Gendarmarket. It is very easy to walk to these spots. We didnt use the hotel restaurant for dinner or breakfast so I cannot cooment on price or quality. There was a problem in the morning of 1st January when the locks to all the doors stopped working. There was a master key and the chap had to go round every floor letting everyone in. A minor inconvenience but the staff were good. Rooms were clean and a reasonable size. Pillows were a bit soft. I guess we could have asked for others if we had wanted. No complaints at all and would use again without any second thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “A Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ai10
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott Berlin was what you expect from this chain. Clean and reasonably priced. They were doing construction in the front of the hotel but you never heard it during sleep hours or the morning. This hotel is walking distance to Spittlemarkt Metro stop so it was easy to get around the city. Nice employees who spoke English and made you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice and quiet. Fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: The hotel, interestingly enough, is not in the old West or East Berlin. It's where 'no man's land' was. A really convenient location within walking distance to nearly everything. There is construction at the moment immediately out front but it's actually not a bad thing as it keeps traffic and noise at minimum. Staff were very friendly and thoroughly helpful. Would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to fault, but not impossible.”
Reviews.Author: voronUk
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you'd expect of a Courtyard : excellent staff, clean, more affordable than the full-fat Marriott or RC, and tucked into a better location than a glance at a map might suggest. Note that there's resurfacing work outside until March; my taxi this morning got to within a few metres of the door but if you have mobility issues call ahead to make arrangements. Turn right out of the front door, walk two short blocks, turn right again onto Zimmerstr., and in a straight line you'll pass Checkpoint Charlie, the Stasi exhibition, the Topography of Terror exhibition with one of the last standing sections of The Wall, and the Martin Gropius Bau. Turn right at the end of that street and Potsdamer Platz is dead ahead. As a side note, if you're feeling adventurous the entrance is literally across the street from the Zimbabwean and Azeri embassies. The rooms are fine. Decent size for Europe; clean; a safe and a minibar, which you can fill; the hotel supplies only a bottle of fizzy water and wisely ignores the London principle that if you open the fridge you've instantly bought everything inside. The on-site restaurant Oleo Pazzo is open for breakfast buffet, lunch and dinner. I had excellent service and can't quibble about the quality, only some of the pricing; the full-tilt breakfast at €21 was overpriced IMHO, as was the in-house Market. Unless you're stuck on Xmas day or very late at night, or you like paying €3 for a bottle of water, map the small supermarkets nearby and stock up. As for the negatives : • Marriott still doesn't get the free wifi-for-all thing • the walls between the rooms are very thin, so if your neighbours speak loudly or are otherwise over-excitable you'll hear plenty of it • the gym is small and has only a literal handful of machines and some small hand weights • I could've done without being locked out of my room just after midnight on NY day, as could the other guests. A one-off, I hope, and the staff were very quick to get everyone into their rooms. Overall a very good hotel to which I'd be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Medium, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: VNOstrava
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Dec. 29, 2011-Jan. 1, 2012. The price changed from 79 Euro in Dec. 29 to 169 Euro the following two days. This prices were WITHOUT breakfast! And we had quite standard (called De Luxe) room, relatively small with one small chair only, nothing special. If the price were up to 100 Euro, this would be good, but 169 is too much for the services they offer. And this was even with our Golden membership card. I am afraid that there are better hotels in Berlin for 169 Euro. Think twice to choose it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, moderate, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NotAccidental
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in Sept. 2011. Rooms and amenities comparable to Courtyards in USA. Excellent location for downtown Berlin: walk to Gendarmenmarkt, Bus and Subway stops close by. We used the bus frequently. Hotel staff helpful. Prices moderate to low for Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “You can't fault it. It is what it is.”
Reviews.Author: rmgstephenson
Reviews.Content: I liked it. Spacious room. Clean. Got it cheap on Expedia in advance. Can't fault it. Walked all around the City and back to the hotel so great location. Did not have breakfast there but walked down to Checkpoint Charlie where there are some nice, fast, cafes that give you what you need for a lot less that the É21 hotel breakfast. Staff seem nice and attentive. No complaints. If you are going to Berlin for a weekend and just want somewhere clean and comfortable to stay then this place is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: OtherJFK
Reviews.Content: The staff was great! Every time I stopped at the desk the woman who checked us in, remembered my name (I wish I could remember her name.) The hotel is new and everything is kept clean. We stayed in a junior suite so we had a lot of room, especially for a European hotel. The breakfast was one of the better ones I've ever seen at a European hotel. I also had dinner one night in the restaurant and it was very good. I really have no complaints except for the cost of using the internet, but this is fairly typical in Europe. We exchanged dollars for Euros at the front desk and got a much better rate than at the Intercontinental Hotel where we stayed our last two nights in Berlin. All in all, I think it was a great hotel for the price and the location is perfect for seeing most of the major tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel! They will charge you without your knowlegde!”
Reviews.Author: Aragorn65
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Courtyard 19-20 November just for one night. I pre-payed for this night 79 GBP. I've paid by credit card. When I 've arrived a receptionist confirmed my paymend, gave me my key (card). Next day I've checked out and I didn't use any facilities. There is additional charge for internet connection, phone calls, to watch TV etc. I've left hotel and return to London. Two days ago I've realised that my credit card was charged an extra 100 GBP as a deposit for an extra facilities which I didn't use. Nobody told me that at the hotel during check in or check out. This is not acceptable. This is stealing!

Reviews.Title: “close to Leipziger Strasse”
Reviews.Author: ChuckRio
Reviews.Content: very good stay. just one day but very nice. 25 minutes from tegel airport, but close do Bradenburg Tor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great standard”
Reviews.Author: d19gal
Reviews.Content: Brihlliant location for walking or public transport to all the key sites in east Berlin. Very high standard accommodation with lovely rooms and a modern approach. Breakfast in hotel very good. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Overall most impressed (especially for the price)

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Dina
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of hotels in the immediate vicinity and all of them are new. I have stayed in the Courtyard and will stay in the Best Western next week. I liked the Courtyard because it was what you'd expect of a Marriott and I got a good weekend rate (79 EUR) for the last two nights and used points for the first night. The rooms are full Marriott standards with great beds and the ususal design. The bathrooms are not quite there but they are big enough, clean and bright. I have a feeling the walls are pretty thin because I could listen to a telephone conversation next door without much difficulty. However, I slept well and was not disturbed by my neighbours. In ten minutes you can walk to Germany's most beautiful spots: the Gendarmenmarkt (designed by the greatest architect of all times) and the Museumsinsel. I would book it again for the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: golfslw
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at this hotel, which is near the Spittelmarket underground station (U6 line) and within easy walking distance of many sites, including Museum Island, Checkpoint Charlie, the History Museum, and the Jewish History Museum. They did upgrade our room at no charge and it was fairly spacious and well organized with a refrigerator (hard to get in Europe), and a large queen bed. Currently there is construction on the street in front of the hotel but it never bothered us. The staff is helpful and some are more knowledgeable about Berlin than others. We did not have any meals there and breakfast was an outrageous price. They said we would get 1 hr of low-speed internet, and have to pay for hi-speed. We used the low-speed internet all week for no charge. One other comment not related to the hotel is that Berlin has a Museum Pass for 19 Euros that allows FREE entry for 3 days to many key museums in Berlin, Charlottenburg, and Postdam. It is a great deal and frees you up from standing in line to get tickets. The Courtyard staff did not about it, but you can buy it any of the museums it lets you into (and the concierge desk at the Westin). The Welcome Card lets you travel for the number of days purchased and gives discounts to museums, tours, and boatrides. You still have to stand in line to purchase tickets. Since we were so close to many of the museums we wanted to visit, we got a Museum Pass for 3 days and saw all the nearby museums, and then bought the Welcome Card for 2 days and could travel. It was great! Don't forget to check the lists of museums they each support so you use your passes wisely. One other comment. There is a lot to do and see in Berlin, and it is spread out, though many of the biggies are in the center. Many of the museums are wonderful, eg. the Bode, Pergamon, and Jewish History Museum, and have their descriptions in English too. They all have English audio guides, either free or for 2-3 euros. You could spend a day in each of them, but that is a lot of time in a museum.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear, Marriott you've blotted your copy book!”
Reviews.Author: Lockeeper
Reviews.Content: Now let me state at the outset, I'm a Marriott fan. I'm besotted with them, my wife tells me so. So it was a no brainer that we booked the Courtyard for our 1st trip to Berlin on my Marriott points....(I'm payng for this trip) 1st off the front of the hotel is a building site, OK not their problem, but an email might have warned me I could not access the hotel easliy, especiall when pulling a case from the U bahn.... Next we got our room, good room 6th floor quiet location. but the safe refused to work and even the staff got locked out of it, the lamp in the room was missing a lamp...so did not work, and when breakfast comes in at 15,18 or 21 Euros..wow, is that expensive....so sorry Marriott only 3 stars from me and I'm being generous cause I'm a fan...

Reviews.Title: “September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Greg W
Reviews.Content: This was a great, great hotel. Room was spacious, clean, comfortable. Great wifi. Front desk was super helpful and nice. The location is pretty good too. Easy walk to Topography of Terror, Check Point Charlie. We even walked to Brandenburg Gate. The immediate area doesn't have much going on, but take a 10 minute walk and you're set. We attempted to take public transportation once and failed, but there is a S-Bahn stop not far. Since there were 4 of us we just took cabs everywhere. Only bad thing - breakfast is a HUGE SCAM. I don't even want to tell you how much I paid for my breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, quiet, confortable and professional”
Reviews.Author: gernouye
Reviews.Content: I staid there 1 night for a professional purpose. But I have really appreciated my stay : beautiful room, very clean, with all amenities (iron included), free fitness room opened 24/24 (not very big but sufficient), one-hour free wifi. The breakfast is very good as well ! I love bread and it was wonderful because there were full of different kinds but also fruits, yogurts, cheese, hams, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, sausages ... and all you can wish to start a new day. Further more the hotel is just 15/20 minutes from Posdamer Platz (shopping centers, restaurants, bars...) Brandenbourg tor, 10 minutes from Friedriechstrass (luxury shopping centers), 5 minutes from Check point Charlie, 20 minutes from Alexander Platz ... A lot of things you can do from this hotel. I will go there again for sure for my next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Henry_Shapiro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a week in Berlin, mostly visiting the many art museums. The Courtyard by Marriott Berlin Mitte turned out to be a perfect choice for us. It is a relatively new, modern and well maintained, reasonably priced hotel, with friendly helpful staff and a great location. It is just two minutes from the U2 Spittelmarkt subway stop -- particularly useful for tourists -- and a 15-20 walk to the many museums on Museum Insel. There are surprisingly few cafes and restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, but it is only about a 10 minute walk to Gendarmenmarkt or the Nikolaiviertel, which both offer many dining options. On nights when it either rained or we were too tired to go out, we ate in the in-house Mediterranean themed restaurant -- while not gourmet, it was reasonably priced and the food was better than good. The hotel would be improved by having a swimming pool and there were some minor annoyances -- the little in-house market should carry the International Herald Tribune and they provide only limited free wifi (enough to check e-mail, but probably not enough to do serious work). If you aren't looking for a luxury hotel with doorman and a plush lobby and gracious bar, this hotel should be for you. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbartels
Reviews.Content: When you come to Berlin the Courtyard is a good choice. It is easy to reach by public transport and is situated in a nice neighbourship. The Hotel is real modern has nice clean rooms and offers a good but a little expensive breakfeast. Try to include it into the room fee. I will defenitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 393L_A_traveller
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the Courtyard Berlin hotel. I had booked a double room at this hotel for 4 nights to visit Berlin on a short break with my boyfriend. On arrival at the hotel we checked in at reception and handed over our confirmation. We were handed a room key and headed up to our room to discover that it was infact a twin room and not a double room as we had booked. We lugged all our luggage back to reception where we were told that they noticed we had booked a double room but that wasn't on the system, there were no available double rooms and that they would come up and push the beds together. We explained that we booked a double room and asked if there was a possibility of being moved to a double room at some point in our visit. The receptionist was incredibly moody and started muttering in German to the lady beside her. She said nothing but eventually just handed us another room key. Luckily this was a double room but unfortunately it was a smoking room (or had been). We are a young couple and don't expect alot from hotels but we do expect to get what we booked, a double non-smoking room, which we didn't receive here and were treated very poorly for asking for what we had paid for. It is understandable that there may have been an oversight and infact there were no double rooms available but the receptionist should have explained this when we checked in and not just hoped we wouldn't notice on entering our room. Very poor service. We will not be returning!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely and convenient spot in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Parsis1
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed for 2 nights at this new and very nice hotel in Berlin. We have stayed at many Courtyards in the USA, Mexico and Europe. This one deserves note for it's location, cleanliness and all around atmosphere. The lobby was inviting and attractive as was the bar/lounge area. We were only a short distance from the train station from which we could get anywhere we wanted to go. If in Berlin, give the Marriott Courtyard a try!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean but not much else”
Reviews.Author: TooManyNotes
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the hotel. We were able to get a great price and it served us well throughout our trip. The staff were very friendly and the room was immaculate. We were pleasantly surprised when the staff allowed us to check in about 4 hours early. The hotel is also in a great location. You're in a position to get to most tourist destinations in Berlin within 10-15 minutes on the local U-bahn and there's a Lidl nearby for when you want a little bit of shopping. And you'll need to use the Lidl because *crikey* are the hotel amenities expensive. Want to buy a bottle of Diet Coke from the little hotel shop? You're looking at several Euros. The hotel restaurant was horrible. Incredibly expensive for the offering and the worst dining experience we had in Berlin. I did, however, like the bed and the bathroom in our room. While I wasn't convinced that the air conditioning worked as well as it should have, I was glad that the fridge wasn't full of the usual minibar fare, but instead empty and unassuming except for a tasty bottle of sparkling water (thank you!). This allowed us to stock up on some Berlin treats from local supermarkets at a reasonable price. Aside from the room there's not that much to do at the hotel. If you desperately need internet then make sure you bring a device with an ethernet port because the rooms don't offer a WiFi connection. This is the first hotel I've been to in Europe (and I've been to some horrible hotels) without a WiFi connection in the room. If you want WiFi you get an hour free in the lobby every day. After that you have to pay for a premium connection. This was not ideal and I found myself clocking up more time in the lobby than I would have liked and some data roaming charges precisely because I left my laptop at home under the mistaken assumption that the rooms had WiFi. If you're going to Berlin to visit the sights and this hotel is on offer I'd snap it up and avoid the hotel restaurant at all costs. If you're going for business I'd think twice on the basis of the wireless availability and charges for ethernet access.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect to tour city.”
Reviews.Author: Porcupine99
Reviews.Content: Near all major sites if you like to walk and about 1 block from U station. Its quiet in the hotel--even with construction nearby. Jr courtyard suite is VERY large. Perfect for our family of 3 and would suit a larger family as well sine it was two separate rooms and a large bath. We thought it would be nice but it was better than expected. Walk around the area a bit to find local restaurants etc as they are not immediately obvious. The hotel restaurant was good but pricey. The breakfast was included and a very complete and tasty buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Destination for Christmas Markets”
Reviews.Author: ledpjk
Reviews.Content: Took a while to write this review, but still feel that this hotel was a great base for visiting Berlin around the time of the Christmas Markets. We arrived in the late morning and the reception staff were helpful and friendly and found a room for us to go up to immediately, a great start to a lovely weekend. We used the little shop in the lobby for some snacks during our stay and enjoyed dinner in the restaurant on 2 of the nights we were there. The hotel is within easy reach of the metro station and with the help of Julia at reception we were given clear guidelines on which markets to visit and what tourist attractions we should see.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: anne-sophieb
Reviews.Content: Location: I would say it was near city center... about a 10 minute walk and a 5 minute walk to the underground. Hotel: Very nice hotel. I would say it is a 4 star. Very clean and the staff was really helpful! Always two or three staff at the front desk to answer you. There is constructions sites around, but we couldn't hear the noises from our bedroom, so no worries there. Good to know: In the lobby, you have a 60 minute free roaming to the internet every day. Room: You have every thing you need: Big room, big bathroom and clean room! I would definitely go back. If not in Berlin, I will do business again with Courtyard/Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, courteous staff, recommended”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFoggSWUK
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late, this was not a problem. The rooms were pleasant, bed was comfy and the shower was a good spray. Nice bathroom and coffee making facilities. Staff were able to speak English (which as a tourist is extremely useful!). Hotel was happy to hold our luggage for us on our last day. There was a very small gym and sauna (which was not open whilst we were there), internet facilities (at a price). Breakfast seemed quite expensive 15+ Euros I believe (but prob cheaper if pre-ordered) - decided to get a snack on the way to our destination. All the locals were pleasant (always worth a walk around the block!). Easy walking distance to Check Point Charlie, and other sites of interest. U-Bahn very close by - familiarise yourself with the stops (you'll need it for sightseeing! - but it's easy enough).

Reviews.Title: “Very solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjygi
Reviews.Content: In a city not known for friendly staff, the staff ( from front desk to wait-staff) at the Courtyard was exceptional. The facility appears brand new and the rooms and public area are very sleek. I would stay again just for the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Central location- good option for weekend sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Collector582
Reviews.Content: STRENGHTS: Convenient location, reasonable weekend pricing vs.standard, possibility of parking car on the street opposites to hotel (cheaper in short-term than garage). Breakfast-quite fine WEAKNESSES: Typical business hotel so it's not a perfect option for romantic weekend for couples. OVERALL: Marriot offers plenty of various weekend packages for weekend stays very often to fill own hotels during weekends so check out prices to get reasonable offer

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Hebbes
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this hotel in April 2010. Got a good deal in room upgrade and parking. A very big room, with excellent facilities. Staff were very friendly; the sent someone up to our room with a treat after we mentioned that we were celebrating our 42nd wedding anniversary. Location is in the former nowhere land between East and West Berlin. U-bahn close by. It is also possible to walk to for instance Alexanderplatz or Kreuzberg, but be prepared for 30 minutes or more on foot. Would certainly recommend this hotel and concider coming back some time. One of the best hotels I know in Germany, certainly in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, close to subway, quiet residential street”
Reviews.Author: vamanosNc
Reviews.Content: This is a standard, well run, clean Courtyard hotel. Really no surprises. The area around the hotel is very quiet and you have to walk to the Nikolaikirche to get to an area where there are a lot of cafes and restaurants. If you take the S-bahn from the main train station (HBF) you have to switch U-2 at Alexanderplatz. If you have luggage it is easier to go out the station on the northwest side, cross the surface tram tracks, enter the plaza and go toward the right of the fountain towards the Saturn store. There is an elevator there that takes you down to the U-2 platform. Going through the station we had to take multiple stairs to get to the u-2.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: jpbs833
Reviews.Content: Good Points - 1.Good location, very close to underground station and we felt it was reasonable walking distance to many key areas. We walked out for restaurants in Potsdam Platz and Babel Platz, walking back around 10.30pm no problems. 2.Cycle hire available at hotel but only 6 bikes on site otherwise they recommend a place near Checkpoint Charlie, good for 24hr hire. 3.Breakfast was very good, hot & cold food, lot of choice. (Our price included breakfast.) 4.Quiet rooms, even our room with connecting door was quiet. Negatives 1.Very busy during weekends so could be difficult to get a table at breakfast but usually people moving on. Staff working very hard in restaurant keeping tables clear. 2.Though provided an excellent breakfast, they didn't seem to top up food in the last half hour. Smoked salmon and pastries disappeared early! 3. Wifi situation!

Reviews.Title: “Meets usual Marriott Courtyard standards”
Reviews.Author: majorswede
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost new, and very nicely decorated. The rooms are large by European standards, and ours even had a small frig. This was great as it allowed us to buy a few gourmet foods in the Galeries Lafayette goumet deli, and avoid the high costs of eating. (The full buffet breakfast here is 22 Euros p/p, so did not try it). The location is somewhat inconvenient, as there is not much nearby in terms of restaurants or stores, but it is close to the U-bahn, so easy access to any tourist sites. Our room was very quiet in term of outside noises, tho the thin walls allowed us to hear the TV next door. I used Marriott free nights, so can't comment on the cost. All in all, a good choice in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- interesting location”
Reviews.Author: chosen2945
Reviews.Content: Very interesting location right in the old no-mans land between East and West Berlin and a short walk to Checkpoint Charlie. Hotel is relatively new (2007 I think) and they had a nice deal on a room upgrade, parking & breakfast -- definitely worth asking about. My room was very comfortable and modern with a look to the east and old Soviet-style concrete apartments -- normally not an exciting view but intereting from an historical perspective. I was disappionted that there was no swimming pool -- it used to be that ALL Courtyards had them but it seem that the new ones do not. They had a very hot sauna in a cramped corner of the 2nd floor -- it was a little strange to me for some reason. Breakfast was excellent. Internet access was good but not wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRDNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the fall with another couple for a few days. The hotel is in a good, quiet location that is accessible to all other parts of Berlin. Many of the main sights are walkable but there is also an U-Bahn stop very close to the hotel. The hotel is clean and modern. I particularly liked that it is right on the old East/West border and you can see where the wall used to run, which is right out in front of the hotel. It's interesting that you can walk in one direction and see the old East-style buildings, and walk West and see the difference there. We did not have the breakfast because it was too expensive and not included in our rate. However, we did find that the coffee machine downstairs was quite good. We also walked to the main street directly behind the hotel when we wanted breakfast and purchased some very reasonably priced danish and pretzels at a bakery that was inside a grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: vmimartins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend (four days) at Easter. The hotel was really busy but we only note that during breakfast... sometimes we have to wait for a table. But the staff was great and they always tried to serve the best way that was possible and they made a good job. Now, some opinions... Location – I think the location is quite good - quiet. At walking distance there are restaurants and a subway station (Spittelmarkt). Nicolaiviertel and Alexanderplatz are a 10minutes walking distance. On a opposite direction is the Checkpoint Charlie and the Jewish Museum. Rooms – Nice size for a city hotel, clean and modern with all the amenities excepted for such a hotel Restaurants – only have breakfast there so my opinion is just about it: Good breakfast with plenty of choice... I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again, but if you are looking for a place near lots of shops you have to to choose an hotel at the Kurfürstendamm area as this area at night is very quiet and calm

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: wendyvz
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from Checkpoint charly, gendarmentmarkt. We had a great easter deal. The only (big) minus is the very expensive wifi. Further is was a great place to stay. Big room with great bed. Free tea and coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hybris rearing its head?”
Reviews.Author: RoccoSiffredi1968
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Berlin City Center a couple of times. Having seen other options I start to get a bit disappointed. 1) The room: the room is nice. Furniture is good quality .Bed is the Marriott bed, so nothing to worry here. One Exception: I had a room with an adjoining door. Great for a communal experience. Not so great if you like your privacy. 2) Gold/Platinum Recognition: None that I am aware of. In fact I am under the impression that the staff purposefully assigns the bad rooms as "upgrades". It happens every time since being on Marriott's higher customer retention levels. I have not seen it anywhere else. 3) The room rates were reasonable at first (5 years back) but now start to be a bit high, especially since breakfast goes extra (18 Euro). 4) The Internet: Not good. The quality is way below the standards I know from Marriott. In summary I feel that the value you get is not matching the price you pay, anymore. I still recommend the Courtyard Berlin City Center, but it is a qualified recommendation. You will probably find Hotels of simillar quality for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bagehot99
Reviews.Content: One night stay in this hotel over a November 2010 week end. The hotel seems fairly new and is standard Courtyard in terms of comfort. I didn't use much of the facility (arrived late, left early) but what I saw was ok. Decent service but poor location. Good but not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & rooms...”
Reviews.Author: mks4
Reviews.Content: Stopped into Berlin for an evening before a flight back to the US. I was pleasantly surprised by the modern entrance and the large room. Everything in the hotel was modern and clean. In the evening, I stepped out and realized that the hotel is in a great location...near lots of touristy things and within walk distance of the Sony Center, Nikolai Viertel, Potzdammer Platz, TV tower, etc. I'd be tempted to try a trendy local hotel next time, but if you want something that is comfortable and consistent, the Courtyard fits the bill. The bar/restaurant looked nice, but I only stopped in for a beer. 25-30 minute cab ride to Tegel airport...easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, basic”
Reviews.Author: AsquareIU
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern. The room was decent size, small bathroom but clean. Bed was very comfortable. There was not wireless internet and the cord provided in the room was very short. Not the fastest internet either and kind of expensive. We arrived late so we just ate dinner there at the bar. The food (pizza and club sandwich) was really good and very reasonable priced. The breakfast had a lot to offer but it was 20euros per person. We ate there a couple mornings just because it was so cold outside and it was a 10min walk to get breakfast somewhere else. The workout facility had nice equipment but only had a bicycle, treadmill, weights. The room was empty every time we were there so the limited amount of equipment was never a problem. We were able to do a late check out which was very handy and they will hold your luggage in a secure location. As for the location, I don't think it was that great. However I have to say we where there in February and it was bitterly cold outside. There were some near by restaurants but everything was closed. Checkpoint Charlie was about a 10 min walk away. Other than that there really wasn't much around. We had to use the trains or taxi to get around. The taxi ride from the airport cost around 20-25euros. Probably about a 15minute trip. Overall, there were no problems or real complaints with the hotel except the location. If we went back we wouldn't stay here again just purely do to the location. I would recommend this hotel however I would make clear they understand the location.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel, poor customer service, not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: ceelynn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Mitte district, but really poorly located for restaurants and any kind of nightlife. Close to Checkpoint Charlie, and the Ger far from anything else of interest. I would suggest staying near the Kurfustendamm rather than in the Mitte district, which is exactly what we did after we recieved a terrible welcome at the Courtyard Berlin City Center (were asked to prove that we'd booked an offer of free champagne and then accused of lying when they didnt see in their system that we had). I could understand a miscommunication or a error in their reservation software, but as we were being called liars, we also over heard another couple being told that the free breakfast offer didnt apply to the day of checkout, and were forced to pay for a breakfast they had previously thought was included in their rate. No one said they were sorry for the misunderstanding or anything and just made the guest cough up the extra money for breakfast. It seems bad service is the norm at this place. I should say that after we called Hotels.com (using international roaming on our phone of course) to prove that the offer was valid and had been part of our reservation, the Courtyard staff did provide the bottle of champagne, but it was too late as we'd already cancelled our second night and moved to the Swissotel where the difference in service was night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: GFM_59
Reviews.Content: Combined a business trip with a weekend in Berlin. Used this hotel many times before as its close to the office. Ideal location for sightseeing too. Was able to check-in early as room was just being inspected. Large room to rear of hotel. Buffet breakfasts are good, although ensure they are included in room rate. Charging for the internet is a pain, although you can check-in for flights and print boarding cards for free in lobby area. Lots of good local restaurants nearby so didn't use the restaurant. Will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sallyahb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights while on business and it was great. The price was inclusive Breakfast and it was OK for a 4 star Hotel. But the internet price was too height. If they really need to charge for the internet, it’s better to incorporate it into the price of the room. How ever the internet in Germany is not that expensive and I think 14 Euros for 90 minutes is too height. The location is very good. 2 minutes to U2 Spittelmarkt. With this route you can go to almost all the important places in the city, such as Berlin Trade Fair and tourist attractions. 10 Minutes by feet to Gendarmenmarkt, Stadtmitte and Friedrichstrasse. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the staff is very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “horrible stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Radiy
Reviews.Content: Hello I have experience today worth hotel service ever in your Countryard by Marriot Berlin Mitte. Receptionist lady could not get what I wanted her to do. I just did not want that she would put on hold my money instead I waned to pay everything in advance at check in. After that moment room operation manager Mareike [-] came and was trying to deal with payment issue in a very rude way. I don’t not what is wrong I just wanted to stay for 3 nights and pay in advance. I came with my company for a business meeting to this hotel and we have totally 55 people with 115 nights to stay. Next meeting I would ask in my company to make at other hotel. Best wishes

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: KelvinYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Only 3 mins walk from Spittlemakt U bahn and the hotel is very modern with great room and very nice staff. Outside the hotel is the line of the Berlin Wall which is interesting. Breakfast a bit pricey at 20 euro.

Reviews.Title: “The Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trockie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights while on business and it was great. The staff is very helpful and courteous. They have a good restaurant, which I ate at for both breakfast and dinner once. Dinner was reasonable but I felt the breakfast was pricey, however this is not unusual for city hotels. My only problem is that there is a charge for internet. Hotels need to do away with this. If they really feel the need to charge, then just incorporate it into the price of the room and don't nickel & dime me about it. It is nearby to a Metro stop that will allow you to move freely about the city and near some good sites. I would highly recommend the hotel and would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a convenient location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyD
Reviews.Content: In general we liked the hotel very much. Rooms are modern and of a good size and spotlessly clean. The staff are young,very professional and extremely helpful. Customer service is of a high standard. The location, just off Leipziger Strasse and close to Spittelmarkt station is good. Although the hotel was full, it was always quiet. We really appreciated being able to do our online check-in on the lobby PCs and print the boarding passes at no charge. The bathroom is lovely but there are a couple of issues. The bath is slippy and using the shower is tricky - extreme care is needed. The hotel is extremely parsimonious with the toiletries and twice we had to ask for shampoo and shower gel - there was never a problem in getting them but nevertheless, they could have been more generous with the allocation. It is expensive, certainly in comparison with comparable hotels in other major cities. Breakfast is pricey and I would recommend the €5 breakfast at Café BrennBar in the old fire station further down the street - exceptional value for a good buffet in a lovely building. Unfortunately only open on week days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ... nothing too especial for the price”
Reviews.Author: DeeFitzsimons
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Berlin for one night as we drove through Germany. We paid 160.00 including breakfast, we got a standard room, with twin beds- the room was 105 and it was a good size. When we made the reservation we asked for a double room, the team at the desk were friendly and offered to send someone from accommodation to join the beds. As I work in hospitality I would be used of this idea... however these beds were not "zip n links" they literally pushed the beds together... not a great idea! When I used the bathroom I noticed some stains on the toilet seat, and hairs in the shower unit. I know cleaning a room is a difficult job but surely the supervisor would have checked this. Also the drinking glasses were both chipped.... We called for assistance and a lovely lady came and made the corrections (except for the bed) We found the breakfast was good and the morning staff were very friendly. I thought for the money we paid for the room, it should have been cleaned and that we should have been able to get a real double bed. Would I stay in this hotel again??? No ... I think I will pick the Radisson Blu!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: javl
Reviews.Content: I gave this a very positive and enthusiastic review in 2007. We stayed here again in August 2010, at the end of a trip combining business and family vacation. I was very disappointed and have no interest in returning here. The main reason we booked here was that we wanted a clean, quite hotel with air-conditioning so that we could get a good night's sleep before the flight back to the States. The room they gave us was not as spacious or as bright as the room we had in 2007, but worst of all was that the AC didn't work well--it seemed to be set for not getting colder than 28 C (or 82 F), and so the room was hot and stuffy. In 2007 there had also been a problem with the AC--they had to move us twice before they found a room with a working AC, but at that time I had chalked it up to an unusual heat wave; now it is apparent that it is an unreliable system. (Note: we stayed in many hotels in Germany that didn't have AC and those places were fine, but when you are expecting it and paying for it, it should work.) The other problem with this hotel is that it has no wi-fi. The connections to the internet are all cable, so if you need to pick up email or use internet on your phone or iPad, you are out of luck. Again, we stayed at some very simple hotels in Germany that had wi-fi, sometimes free. Even Marriott's competitors--Hilton and Radison Blu--have wi-fi, and the Radisson's if free. It was just not a welcoming place this time. We had requested a roll-away bed for our son, but it was not there when we arrived and we had to request it again, and then wait around for it. At every other hotel we stayed at, his bed was made up already, and that was very welcoming. The place is clean with a professional staff, and it is still a Marriott Courtyard, but it seems to have lost the beat it had in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, Internet bad”
Reviews.Author: Sens4life
Reviews.Content: Was surprised to see such a highly rated hotel for under 80 Euros a night, and it did not disappoint. Located very close to the Spittlemarkt metro station, the rooms were large and decorated nicely. There is a Mediterranean restaurant onsite, who also provides the room service. Since it is a restaurant, the quality is a bit better and the price a little cheaper than typical room service. The staff was very helpful, great English. My only complaint was the Internet, they offer a free basic service and a premium service. The free service (wired) felt like it was intentionally bogged down in an attempt to convince customers to upgrade for 17 Euros a night. Marriott, get with the freaking times. Even if my conspiracy suspicion is incorrect, the Internet service is a joke and if it's necessary to do electronic business on your trip, this is going to frustrate you. I've used Wifi in 20 Euro hostels that was 10 times faster than this. Other than that, I'd recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sildenaviel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently situated in the new center of Berlin with many attractions being in walking distance. The next tube station is also quite close. The rooms are nice and spacy enough for either one or two persons. The small wellness center offers a gym and a sauna. Not too big, but nice to do something different for a change. Breakfast is very good, although you will find it not changing a lot from day to day, when you stay there for longer. The staff is great, very friendky and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Another great European Courtyard hotel”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on Axel Springer Strasse, close to Spittlemarkt U-Bahn Stop on the U2, but is equally close to Checkpoint Charlie/Friedrichstrasse areas of town and about 10-15 min walk from Alexanderplatz. First impressions were very good and similar to other Courtyard's I have stayed in around Europe. Was given a room on the top floor overlooking the inside, which was quiet and comfortable. Room was probably about 28-30sq meteres in size with a fridge in the room for keeping personal items, ironing board, air conditioning which worked a treat and very comofortable beds. The only possible downside was the bathroom which was a little on the smallish and dated side, but in all the hotel was a great place to stay for the four days that we spent here. Cleaning of the room was excellent, in that we asked for the bed sheets to be changed every day (hey if they offer it and you are paying for it, you should get it) and lo and behold this was done on each day we asked for it without fail. Impressive! The Food market downstairs was very handy after stumbling in from a club at about 4-5am most nights, as this was very reasonably priced for a hotel, it wasn't actually that much more than a shop so it was nice to see a hotel not charge the earth for products that they would usually charge a bomb for via room service and the minibar. As with all Courtyards in Europe, you can print off your boarding passes for free at the hotel PC's which is a feature that the hotels really should brag about becuase this is one thing that is worth a millon for travellers who are fussy about seats on planes or need to check in on line! In All a great hotel, ok not as good as the Wallstreet Park Plaza which is around the corner, but for a 3 star this is more than acceptable and worthy of all the good reviews posted on here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieSKY
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and asked for rooms next to eachtother and late checkout before we left from home. The checkin went smoothly. The rooms are nice with 2 chairs, a table, fridge, safe and a desk. The room was average size with a small window that opens. The bathroom is average size. Each floor has a icemaker. No minibar but a store with food. The store is open 24 hours a day. The service is great. Extra blankets were brought swiftly. Parking in front of the hotel is expensive. Park in Der Alte Jacob strasse and it's free and safe. Subwaystation Spittelmarkt is a 2 minutes walking distance. When traveling in a group buy the kleingruppekarte (small group cart for up to 5 people) and you can travel unlimited for the whole day. The hotel is near Checkpoint Charlie. I'd recommend the hotel and the city to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: malfuf
Reviews.Content: We spent our Easter Holiday in Berlin and booked for 3 nights in this hotel. We loved it - great staff, clean room with excellent bed and very good breakfast! The location is perfect, just a short walk to Checkpoint Charlie, or a few minutes to the metro-station (Spittel Markt). We definitely recommend the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but beware when booking via internet”
Reviews.Author: redsilence1
Reviews.Content: A good, modern hotel with easy access to the most important sites in Berlin. Moden, clean rooms and extremely quiet even though it is in the middle of the town following the path of the former wall between East and West. We booked for 4 nights via the internet and received a reasonable rate, only to be advised at arrival that breakfast was not included on the last day. This is extremely bad business practice especially since the cost of 25.00 Euro per person is totally unrelating for what one gets for their money. The Manager kindly resoved our problem, but I would advise anybody to read the excessively small print when booking in future. Restaurant clean and good, though we did not really like the somewhat 'modern' taste of the food. A more conservative presentation would not go amiss. In all a pleasant and enjoyable stay here though, just as one has come to expect from Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “All that I needed in a perfect quite location.”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysonRush
Reviews.Content: Brand new Courtyard Berlin City Center. Located really close to Friedrichstraße where can get the subway (U-Ban) to anywhere on the city. Rooms are large with many comforts such complimentary tee & coffee which is great on the winter time. Some negative points are the Internet speed if you need to work. The "free" practically do not run and the paid is slow for EUR 14,00. A great positive point was the Dry Sauna that runs 24hrs. After along meeting day on the cold, the sauna was gorgeous at the end of the night, before bed. The hotel also has a great mini market which was great for the snacks and a practical restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Highland_Saint
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends for a weekend in Berlin and found the hotel to be great. We got a great deal and very comfortable rooms. The key selling point for us was that the hotel is within easy walking distance of each of the key sites including; Checkpoint Charlie, Alexanderplatz, Museum Island, Brandenburg Gate, Holocaust Museum, Potzdamer Platz etc. Very modern, great staff would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sallious
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cosy, good rooms and clean, the restaurant is average.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Yerevan75
Reviews.Content: The Good: - Quiet location, excellent breakfast with many healthy options, friendly staff, high speed internet The Bad: - Our room was a suite at the end of the corridor. The bedroom was very comfortable and surprisingly elegant. Bathroom was spacious and faultless. The odd part was the suite space outside the bedroom which resembled a narrow hallway that led to a small square room. The room supposedly serves as a tv room and has a small dining table and a sofa but we just used it to store our bags and throw around our dirty laundry. The ugly: - Sorry to dissapoint you but there isnt anything ugly about this hotel The Bottomline: will definatly stay in this hotel again but will opt for a standard room next time

Reviews.Title: “Close to Checkpoint Carlie, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Couple_UK
Reviews.Content: As to be expected with a chain hotel, all was fine with the room and cleanliness. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located a short walk to Checkpoint Carlie.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KB_Kildare
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family in 3-bed room. Clean, friendly, helpful staff. Excellent breakfast - great selection of hot & cold. Location suitable for all access to berlin tourist attractions - closest being Checkpoint Charlie. Underground/subway system excellent, station within 2mins walk to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: ficholin
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for 5 nights earlier this month. Everything is 'a la carte' and very expensive. Parking (19 euros per night)...not worth it when I was able to park the car less than a block away for free on the street. Breakfast in the hotel was nice, but at 24 euros way overpriced...again less than a block away, I was able to find a slightly lesser quality all you can eat breakfast buffet for 5 euros. When compared to other non-chain 3 star hotels in europe, the courtyard comes out ahead, but when compared to Courtyards in the USA or full Marriott hotels in Europe, it falls very short. I expected the Courtyard to be one notch down from the full Marriott hotel, but instead found it to be at least three notches down. Just before I stayed at this hotel, I stayed at the full Marriott in Leipzig for 3 nights (just 2 hours south of Berlin)...the difference was night and day....including towel material, bedding and beds themselves.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: mfd_gr
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel in August 2008.Berlin is an awesome city and this hotel made our stay to be perfect. We arrived late after midnight, though ten minutes were enough to check in. Breakfast : just perfect. There was a wide variety of bread, croissants, fruits, yoghurts, ham and cheese, etc. We had prebooked a breakfast included room and the breakfast did really worth every euro. Rooms: the rooms were really too big and convenient. We stayed in a superior room, which has two huge twin beds. The bathroom was very clean too, although a bit small. Location: just 50 metres from the hotel you can find the metro station Spittelmarkt. A bus station is near the hotel too. All in all good transport options to all major atractions of the city. If you are going to visit Berlin, stay at this hotel!! If you want to learn more about our experience in Berlin, visit our website www.freeeuropeguides.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quiet comfy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Nywla
Reviews.Content: I obtained a great rate on this hotel after a miserable week in a much pricier hotel in Cologne. I was looking forward to Marriott beds after a week on a $20 mattress flung across some boards at a much higher price. The room was quiet, dark and comfortable. Internet was free, though slow, in hourlong blocks (the previous hotel had charged a night's fee for a week of internet). I did not get the breakfast included but there was (instant!) coffee in the room. The bath had washcloths, too rare a commodity in Europe and worked well. The location is a block or so off the beaten path, but within a block is Leipzig strasse or the Ubahn, and within 10 minutes walk is Freidrichstrasse or the Gendarmeplatz; fine except when it rains. The inhouse restaurant is great; I highly recommend Entrecote on the way to Checkpoint Charlie 10 minutes away. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Courtyard Hotel in Berlin in July 2008. The hotel was quite new and the rooms were spacious. The location was a couple minutes from the Spittelmarkt subway station. It was a quiet location. The breakfast was very good and included a large selection of hot and cold foods. Best if you can get a deal that includes breakfast. The staff were friendly. Berlin is a great city for sightseeing plenty of things to see and do. I would be happy to stay in this hotel again. We have stayed in a few of the courtyard hotels over the years and have always been impressed with them. On this trip we also visited Potsdam which was a 30 minute train ride away.

Reviews.Title: “quite good 3* better than other German self rated 4* hotels”
Reviews.Author: joe1968
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel isn't very charming: in the middle of some residential buildings from soviet area (you are in former Eastern Berlin) and the streets around are empty at night even the signs show that you need to pay 9-22 ... maybe they want to be prepared for better times.... you can find cheaper possibilites to park your car in private parkings around (negotiate!!) - however there isnot so much in the close surroundings First time for us in a Courtyard Marriott (we usually prefer the Marriotts and Renaissances) and I'd say this is a bit better ('caus newer) property of this brand (I've read horrible reviews and seen pictures about the Courtyard Frankfurt Messe). Priceline sold it to me for incredibly cheap 44 EUR (bid $45) as a 3* level hotel even I have the feeling that this hotel is better than some German 4* hotels. Rooms are decent and simple in a style what I call Novotel decor. Nothing cosy or elegant. Bathtub (!) and (almost) Marriott Beds and linen... What I didn't like was the noise the doors make when slashed and the - for me - cheap look of decor.... Check their special deals stay3pay2 with BF included. Internet NOT free as usual (not yet) Good for short term stay if you are really on budget or need only a place to sleep (better option than a road motel for same price)

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: KristinaRiga
Reviews.Content: This was the greatest value for money stay I have ever had. The hotel looked really new, clean. The rooms were fully equipped incl. tea nad coffee making facilities, iron and ironing board; the bad was fantastic. The breakfast was just fantastic with a great selection of foods that have been promtly replenished. It is now my favourite place in Berlin to stay

Reviews.Title: “fine stay at reliable courtyard- great location for metro access”
Reviews.Author: NavTrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with points. Had normal king room on top floor. Location: 2 minute walk from U-Bahn Spittelmarkt (U2 line) stop. This is very convenient for seeing Berlin, which is a large city. It is also relatively centrally located- you can walk to Checkpoint Charlie, the Jewish Museum, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, etc. Also, we could actually see the line of cobblestones marking the location of the Wall outside our window (room 607). The only con to the location was that there weren't really any restaurants within 2 blocks of the hotel. There are a number of restaurants about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. There is a grocery store about 3 mins from the hotel. Room: very clean, appears to be one of the "new" styled Courtyards. Large closet, nice desk, nice arm chair. Small fridge. Bath was clean and average size. Lobby appeared nice. Staff was very helpful and spoke excellent english (when my german failed me). There is a "business" center, but the internet is very pricey! We found out on the second day that there is in fact "free" (but slower) internet in the room if you have your laptop. There is a restaurant that looked good, but we didn't try it. I would stay again, especially with points (although the rate of 119E seemed pretty good for Berlin).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: travelvegAR
Reviews.Content: Stayed for about a week at the Courtyard a couple of weeks ago and impression was mixed. On one hand, liked the newness of it, the bar (the fact that there was one and that it stayed open late), some of the staff, and location not too bad. On the other hand, some of the staff were rude and unhelpful (while others were perfectly pleasant), rooms were technically "clean" however, towels were scarce and threadbare, the air conditioning did not work the entire time we were there (and no attempts to repair it when we mentioned it). We weren't charged for a pot of coffee (which had to be obtained from the bar if brought to the room) on two occasions, charged 12 Euros for it on three other occasions (and served with attitude). Claims of being a "business' hotel didn't hold up when we needed to send something FedEx (or any overnight service). Front desk basically said they couldn't help with this in any way and suggested that we go to the post office (unspecified location). Not sure whether we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic choice”
Reviews.Author: Nelsontouch
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights in April 09. Hotel is almost brand new and rooms are clean and by European (or in fact US) chain hotel standards good sized. Great king bed, good sized bathroom. It's obviously not absolutely in the middle of everything, but it is only minutes from it by subway or bus. (Spittal Markt -- don't worry , it means "hospital market") station is only 2-3 minutes walk and takes you direct to the old East Berlin city center (near Alexander Platz) or in the other direction to Potsdamer Platz (instant Houston) or Wittenberg Platz (KdW). Leiptzer Strasse is lined with basic but very serviceable stores -- coffee shops, drug store, bike store, grocery, local restaurants. Staff speak excellent English. When we were there cabs were on the stand outside almost always and front desk will call if not. Breakfast (like most hotel buffets) is grotesquely overpriced at 21 Euro, but you may qualify for it to be included in rate and if not there are plenty of options within a few minutes. Wifi also expensive.

Reviews.Title: “It is just OK”
Reviews.Author: KYBALION
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to city center. Hotel building is big but rooms are very small, including bathrooms. Generally clean. No minibar and no room service. Very nice staff. Ate twice in the hotel restaurant, good food but choices are limited and service is slow. In Berlin, there are always cabs in front of most hotels but this one, there is no cabs, and hotel is not stiuated in amain road, so that you have to ask to reception to call a cab all the time when you need one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mack09
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel! Its very new and modern, and the staff is very friendly. Our room was clean and we slept so well in the comfy bed! The curtains close all the way to block out any light and the neighborhood is relatively quiet. Its in a really cool location- from the lobby you can see where the Berlin wall used to be. The hotel is sorrounded by interesting GDR architecture, but is also near a park with a (soviet) WWII momument. Its the most interesting area- new and old sort of all jumbled together. Its only about a 5 min walk to the subway too- very convenient location. Parking is 19 Euro a day, but we realized later that we could probably have parked on the street for free. Doh! The hotel is a great value, but breakfast is very over-priced. Its a very nice buffet, but is certainly not 21 Euro nice. Save a little money and grab breakfast elsewhere. Otherwise, we were extremely happy with the hotel. We visited the hotel bar twice and ate there once, and its a nice comfortable atmosphere. There was no minibar, but downstairs there is a sort of convenience store next to the front desk. This seems to be the new theme for Courtyards in Europe, and it works well. We love Berlin, and definitely will stay at this hotel again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mesocog
Reviews.Content: Our previous experience in Berlin in 2006 was not all that great. We had booked a room during the world cup through h*tels.com and when we arrived it looked like the proprietors (greedy harpies btw) had painted a crack house and called it a hotel. So I had some mild trepidation on returning to Berlin. Of course, we went with a large chain this time, and I was quite pleased with the Courtyard Marriott. This place looks brand new. I am always amazed with the German work ethic. I saw one of the staff outside with a tub pulling grass that had grown too high between the cobbles. That attention to detail is a luxury in europe really. Let me break down the Pros/Cons for you: PROS: Amazingly friendly staff. They went above and beyond to orient us to the area and point out locations. Anytime we had a question about the area they pulled out a map and started making notes for us so we could get around. Great English too. Clean (as in brand new) appearance. I couldn't find any blemishes in our room and I am as critical as it gets (6th floor btw ). Quiet area. Walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie. Not too far from Spittelmarkt UBahn (subway) stop (maybe 3-4 minutes). You are only a few stops from Potsdamer Platz which is a great place for food, drinks and of course the big live shows. CONS The immediate area feels a bit vacant. So, it's very quiet (which is good), but you have to walk a few minutes to get into an area with lots of food/shops. Also, it is not as well lit as I would have liked at night, but it didn't feel unsafe or anything like that. The breakfast options in the hotel were a bit too pricey for me. However, I am cheap (and the dollar is near worthless) so maybe that's not a problem for you. The contintenal was 14 euros, the full buffet 18 euros. My only problem was the lack of an a-la-carte menu for the breakfast. We just wanted coffee and a croissante. Anyway, we had coffee and they didn't even charge us for that b/c we didn't have the breakfast. We walked a few minutes to Friedrichstasse and had a coffee and bread at the coffeeshop company so no major problem there. I would suggest this place to anyone who wants to see some shows over at Potsdamer platz, or just wants to make sure they get a nice clean place with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very special care for handicapped person”
Reviews.Author: Mano40
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one week stay at this great hotel. I was with my mother who has trouble walking and is using a wheel chair for longer distances. With my booking for the hotel I had requested a room for disabled visitors and we got a very nice room with a very large bathroom with a shower and toilet specially equiped for the handicaped (supporting bars next to the toilet and special bars for a good grip in the shower). The staff of the hotel was very, very friendly and always taking good care of us. I would sure advise this hotel for any handicaped visitor of Berlin. Close to the hotel (3-5 minutes walk) is the metrostation (subway)(station name: spittelmarkt) even though the metromaps of Berlin state this metro station as not prepared for the handicapped (no lift/elevator) we found that it does have a lift and were able to use this station when traveling by metro through Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel near U-bahn”
Reviews.Author: pauloregon
Reviews.Content: My colleagues stayed at the Marriott downtown and I ended up at the Courtyard by Marriott for a recent business trip. Hotel is clean and updated. Wired LAN in the rooms is expensive, but access for 1hr at a time is free. The hotel is a short walk from the U2 U-bahn line, Spittelmarkt station. This made getting around town very easy. Workout room is very small with just a small selection of treadmills and stair climbers, but better than nothing. Hotel staff was helpful with maps and even have some jogging/running route suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service when needed”
Reviews.Author: Fitzcaraldo
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcome. Pleasant place, just as would be expected. Bit expensive on the broadband front. My colleague was expecting a parcel to be delviered by the courier company on the day of departure. It failed to appear by the time of departure, in fact the hotel thought that it had been given to the wrong guest. However at the airport, the hotel discovered it and arranged a taxi to take the parcel to us, while we were waiting at the gate. They pulled out the stops - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brynspot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The immediate location doesn't look like much but it is a much shorter walk than expected to Museum Island in one direction and Checkpoint Charlie in the other. The hotel restaurant is pretty bad - good desserts, though. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ColoColo
Reviews.Content: As others have pointed out, the hotel's area is not the liveliest; but it's only 2-3 minutes walk to an underground station; and a pleasant 10 mins walk to different attractions in the Mitte area. Rooms look fresh, new and relatively big for European standards. I had breakfast and it's your usual breakfast buffet you'd find in any Marriott. Overall, good centrally located hotel. Very good value for money; would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern rooms in decent locale”
Reviews.Author: Ophelia89
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd hotel I have stayed at in Berlin this month, and it was definitely the nicest. The rooms are modern, clean, quiet and comfortable. I thought the property was brand new, based in it's sparkling appearance, but the staff told me it is in fact almost 3 years old. There's a decent, casual restaurant on the property, and a 24 hour gift shop with sodas, snacks, small souvenirs etc. The location is decent for E. Berlin sightseeing (10-20 minute walk to most sights) and one can walk to the Tiergarten, and even W. Berlin sights if one is so inclined.

Reviews.Title: “US Hotel Standards in a Berlin Location”
Reviews.Author: starter1
Reviews.Content: I've read many of the other reviews on this hotel and did before booking this one. Most of them held a small piece of truth for me.
